body.p: “I see a flock of snow buntings. They are feeding exclusively on that ragged weed which I take to be Roman wormwood. Their tracks where they sink in the snow are very long “,” i.e. have a very long heel “,” thus: [image] or sometimes almost in a single straight line.”
PE 14, pg. 391/ 9 November 1858-7 April 1859 / NNPM MA 1302:34 / T vol. # XXVIII / PDF # XVII / JXI
